intro: Elatostema variegatum, commonly known as the variegated elatostema, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that often display striking variegation patterns. It produces tiny greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Elatostema variegatum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
